title: Analyze curve: x^2+4 y^2=7+3xy part - b

content.description: Consider the curve given by x2 + 4y2 = 7 + 3xy.
content.question: Show that there is a point P with x-coordinates 3 at which the line tangent to the curve at P is horizontal. Find the y-coordinate of P.

frqParts.text: Show that there is a point P with x-coordinates 3 at which the line tangent to the curve at P is horizontal. Find the y-coordinate of P.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
